conclusion: Cars A and B are traveling in the same direction on a straight road. Their v-t graphs are shown in the figure. It is known that the two cars are side by side at t=30 s.
Car A has a constant velocity of 40 m/s throughout the time period.
Car B starts at 0 m/s and has constant acceleration, with velocity increasing linearly with time.

premise: Car B's velocity increases linearly with time, and at t = 20 s, v_B = 40 m/s.
Car A's velocity is constant at 40 m/s.
conclusion: Car A's position function: x_A(t) = 40t + C_A.

premise: Car B's velocity function is v_B(t) = 2t m/s.
conclusion: Car B's position function: x_B(t) = t² + C_B.

premise: Cars are side by side at t = 30 s.
conclusion: 40(30) + C_A = (30)² + C_B, resulting in C_A = C_B - 300.
Cars are side by side at t = 10 s and t = 30 s.
Position functions are x_A(t) = 40t - 300 and x_B(t) = t².
D(t) = 40t - 300 - t² for t between 10s and 30s.

premise: Differentiate D(t) = 40t - 300 - t² and set to zero.
The maximum distance between Car A and Car B between the two instances when they are side by side is 100 meters, occurring at t = 20 seconds.
conclusion: Therefore, the maximum distance between the two cars is 100m.
